tasks.title: Measure 3 â€“ Act within the hosting providerâ€™s scope
tasks.description:
### ğŸ¯ Objective

**Adapt** rules to attack variations within the hosting providerâ€™s scope.

### ğŸ“Œ Actions

* Activate the hosting providerâ€™s anti-DDoS service (upstream of firewall and router)

  * Enable the service if available
  * Update blocking rules and rate-control thresholds based on discriminants identified during qualification
  * If available, enable the following:

    * Block requests to invalid destinations (non-exposed ports)
    * Block malicious source IPs via CTI
    * Bot detection (dynamic captcha or JavaScript challenge)
    * Blocking by JA3/S and JA4 fingerprints
    * Other relevant anti-DDoS features

* Limit requests on network infrastructure equipment

  * Administration network

    * Implement QoS to prioritize admin traffic during unavailability
  * Firewall

    * Update firmware if a DoS exploits a vulnerability
    * Harden rules to limit exposed services and protocols. Reject the rest
    * Enable malformed packet blocking or DoS protection if possible
    * Block based on discriminants from qualification (source IP, protocol, geolocation)
    * Block known malicious source IPs (CTI)
    * Filter by authorized IPs/blocks/AS/geolocation
    * If non-essential services are targeted, apply temporary blackholing on the target IPs while restoring indirectly affected services according to importance
    * \[Volumetric DoS]

      * Apply rate limiting. Define thresholds per source IP (bandwidth, packets/s, requests with malicious signatures)
      * Monitor to detect side effects
      * Apply traffic shaping to prioritize certain flows
    * \[Protocol-based DoS]

      * Reduce connection tracking lifetimes
      * Limit SYN packets/s per source and destination IP
      * Enable SYN cookies
      * Set ICMP/s and UDP/s thresholds per source IP
  * Web Application Firewall (WAF)

    * Update attack signatures
    * Simplify configuration to reduce CPU load
    * \[Volumetric DoS]: apply rate limiting or traffic shaping
    * \[Application DoS]

      * Block malicious requests by signature
      * Apply precise rules on observed L7 discriminants. Avoid applying during major volumetric attacks to prevent CPU overload
    * Limit web sessions
    * Enable caching
    * Bot detection (dynamic captcha or JavaScript challenge)
    * Reduce connection tracking lifetimes
  * Load balancer

    * Apply rate limiting
    * Reduce connection tracking lifetimes

* Limit requests on resources

  * Hypervisor

    * Optimize resources in case of saturation

      * Distribute load (create instances)
      * Allocate or reallocate resources
      * Separate instances by geographic zones (sharding)
      * Update the hypervisor
      * Migrate other machines to free resources
      * Migrate the impacted machine to relaunch other services
  * Front-end or application servers

    * System saturated

      * If inaccessible: cut production network access, reboot, apply optimizations, reopen traffic
      * Allocate more resources
      * Adjust limiting system thresholds (ulimit, systemd)
      * Low-level optimization (Linux sysctl, Windows System Resource Manager)
    * \[Application DoS]

      * Temporarily disable problematic non-essential features (search engine, forms)
      * Limit web sessions
      * Enable caching
      * Bot detection (dynamic captcha or JavaScript challenge)
      * Reduce connection tracking lifetimes
      * Optimize web and component configuration (Apache, Nginx, IIS; .NET, JRE; Tomcat, JBoss, Node.js)
      * Serve static content separately and dedicate servers
      * Restart services if blocked processes are found, after assessing impact
  * Database servers

    * \[Application DoS]

      * Optimize resources and configuration in case of saturation
      * Add instances if clustering allows

### âœ… Deliverables

* All actions performed documented in the **activities** of this task
